channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hedge overgrowing footpath in Manor Road, 27th June
item.description:
The hedge alongside Manor Road has grown over the footpath. The footpath is alongside a 60mph length of road. The reduced width is dangerous to pedestrians who are unable to pass each other without one person having to step off the pavement and into a heavily trafficked road. A lady has reported that she had to walk in single file with an 8 year old child.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Mackenzie Way, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog bin overflowing, 27th June
item.description:
Pic shows excessive dog faces desperately needs emptying.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Red Pippin Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge & skip on pavement, 27th June
item.description:
The owner of 55a Alstone Avenue has an overgrown hedge & a skip partially on the pavement. This is making using the pavement very restrictive for the elderly, people with prams and the disabled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Alstone Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Lane., 27th June
item.description:
Overgrown vegetation due to residents in Southam Lane and Ratcliffe Lawns not cutting their hedges back. They don't use the lane so it doesn't affect them. It makes access to my home almost impossible, together with visitors and deliveries.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Gravel Walk, Southam
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Orchard Close, Cheltenham

item.title: Rubbish, 26th June
item.description:
Rubbish keeps accumulating here. There are several bin bags containing paperwork, amongst other things, currently, so maybe this could be investigated rather than just collected...the serial dumpers might be able to be identified and encouraged not to flytip again!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 53 Marsland Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown plants on side of road, 26th June
item.description:
Please could you trim the vegetation on this road - it's impossible to see the road when you are trying to leave the junction. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Cowley

item.title: A lot of debris on the road, 26th June
item.description:
A lot of debris, sticks, stones, grit, mud etc… is on the road, when it rains heavily the drains get blocked. It is on a slope and this causes a problem

item.title: Road surface is once again beginning to crack and sink., 24th June
item.description:
This was repaired recently but wasn't done thoroughly which means that once again the surface is cracking. It is as if there is a potential sink hole below the surface and I think this will quickly become dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 99a Montpellier Terrace, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath overgrown, 24th June
item.description:
